text: Italy in Spain the two countries which
have suffered the highest numbers of
deaths have both reported progress in
tackling the corona virus outbreak
Spain's released its latest figures
showing the coronavirus death toll has
risen to 12,000 418 an increase
overnight of 674 deaths which is part of
a trend emerging over recent days
suggesting that the number of people is
dying each day continues to go down and
therefore the infection rates may be
lower than had been previously thought
just to underline that Spanish Prime
Minister has said he is going to request
the Spanish Parliament the court has to
vote to extend the lockdown measures by
15 days that would take them till the
26th of April in Italy there's also hope
that the crisis has passed its peak are
your correspondent Jima Kensi is in Rome
for us we had some encouraging signs
yesterday that not only has Italy
reached the peak of its epidemic but
things could be starting to turn around
so we had fewer deaths yesterday than
the day before 681 that's the first time
deaths have been in the 600's for well
over a week now and for the first time
since this crisis began the number of
patients in intensive care fail
hospitals finally starting to see some
progress the lockdown at the moment is
to take place until the 13th of April so
that's after Easter now there was some
suggestion from Italy's emergency
response team just the other day that
this could well be extended into May I
think it's too early to say yet how long
this good lockdown is going to go on for
it's very much going to depend on what
happens to the infection rates over the
coming weeks and the death rates because
the authorities here are desperate to
prevent the the likelihood of a second
outbreak or a resurgence of infections
they're saying is too early to ease
restrictions and restrictions will be
tight today on Palm Sunday roadblocks
are being stepped up people please
telling people please to stay at home
not to do what they would usually do on
Palm Sunday here which is visit friends
and family is taking that traditional
gift of knowledge branch round to each
other Jean they're reporting from Rome
in the Vatican Pope Francis led a solemn
Palm Sunday service at London usually
quiet some pieces
silica the first time ever the service
has not included any public
participation because of coronavirus
instead is taking place behind closed
doors as part of isolation measures in
place
